revised_title: Marine Animal Burrowing and Boring Mechanisms
tldr: The author, Edward Osler, examines the mechanisms used by various marine animals to create their habitats, such as burrowing and boring. He describes the methods employed by different species, including Nereides, Arenicola piscatorum, Terebella conchilega, Spatangus, bivalves, and more, and discusses the role of their anatomy and secretions in these processes.
